intro: Mendoncia mutisii, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped, while its stems are erect and often branched. Mendoncia mutisii is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
